alert.note: Alert for Duval; Nassau (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 04 at 3:15PM EST until January 04 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Nassau County in northeastern Florida... Northeastern Duval County in northeastern Florida... Southeastern Camden County in southeastern Georgia... South central Glynn County in southeastern Georgia... * Until 400 PM EST. * At 315 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles northeast of Callahan, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. Possible tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... St. Marys, Kingsland, Fernandina Beach, Jacksonville International Arpt, Kings Bay Base, Yulee, Cisco Gardens, Amelia City, Little Talbot Island and Jekyll Island. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EST for northeastern Florida...until 600 PM EST for northeastern Florida...and southeastern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EST for northeastern Florida...until 600 PM EST for northeastern Florida...and southeastern Georgia.
